title: Changes coming to web login bar
body:
Hey everybody, as you may have seen on the [Music of League of Legends promo page](http://promo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/music-of-league/), we've got a bit of a facelift coming for the login bar that sits at the top of most of our League sites.

Over the past couple years, we've expanded our web presence beyond LeagueofLegends.com. Though each of our sites serves a unique purpose, we could do a better job tying them together as a network. The new bar has links to all our major destinations: though this is a simple change, it's now much easier to move across League's web experiences. With these improvements to network navigation we're also paring down our navigational menus across the main areas of LeagueofLegends.com - in some cases removing them entirely or moving elements into the drop-down under your summoner name.

While we were considering other valuable additions to the login bar, we pulled the ticker into the redesign. You can now quickly spot-check server status updates from the web in situations where you might not be able to access the patcher or landing page.

More details:
http://i.imgur.com/fi2XDbg.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/WxTPAug.jpg

You'll start to see the new login bar being rolled out over the coming weeks. Let us know what you think!

replies.body: Excellent.
Moobelz, what is the "PBE" button for and why do I not have it?
Right off do you know if it will extend to the Dev Blog or eSports website?

We're working to have the new bar replace every instance of the old bar design, across all our sites.  Timing-wise... teams that own individual features will update their bar when they're able (they may have more pressing stuff they need to tackle.)  But, yeah, the goal is to roll this out broadly across our sites.

Just to confirm if I understand this correctly but does that mean that each different site will possibly have different (for lack of a better word) widgets on the bar? I can see that being very useful.
Potentially.  The design and the tech are very flexible, enough to accommodate region-, site- or player-specific features.

can you pleeeaaase give it a dropdown menu? It is so painfully annoying having to click community then click red tracker just to get to the dev tracker, compaired to how it used to be. Web pages don't load very quickly for me, so the less pages I have to visit the better.
If the new bar replaces the current Boards bar, we will no longer be able to view the forum archives because there are no dropdowns and Community is a direct link to the Boards.

Players will still have a path to reaching the archives.  This will either exist in the login bar or on other pages on the site (which may do a better job than the login bar can of keeping the archives easily findable.)

Are dropdowns being considered as retained functionality?  Even with the path existing in such a way, it can still end up requiring far more clicks/pages than necessary to navigate to the desired location.
Just make sure you keep other language sites in mind too. Right now I can't reach the hungarian forums because it redirects me to the eune forums.
Hmm. We'll sync with the EU community team about that;  it should always be sending you to the correct forums for the region/language that you choose.
Thanks, now it's working and it's good to notice it can even be accessed with euw accounts.
At first I was skeptical about this, and wondered if it would look weird. but it's not too bad, I actually kind of like it. So far, so good. =P Seems like a pretty neat feature
Will Boards notifications also find their way into the login bar?

What's going on with the new "L" icon?

I saw it on the PBE ages ago, then nothing came of it. Now it's on the site but not the client?

What's up Riot?
Will it be possible to reach the redtracker from the frontpage again? Right now it is either not possible or well hidden.

I hope we gonna still be able to open the champion/item page while being on boards (without mor "click"), it help if you want to have a quick look at some number when you are in a discussion.

For the moment, the lack of subsection in news is a bit weird too
Looking great! I've got one question about this bar though. Since there is a PBE tab under profile are we going to be able to link our PBE accounts to our main accounts?

cool butcant you please get on the more pressing matters at hand such as your immense amount of customer issues with the patch? Not even a single update or announcement has been made on that so plenty of people doubt your dev team knows wtf is going on... so please illuminate us on whats being done to fix this huge problem for thousands of people right now.
AFAIK riot has different teams working on different features and upgrading the website has nothing to do with the patch.
I think the information on the login bar should be centralized, as well as the LoL logo below it.

These are some really cool changes!
